name: Vegetarian Thai Green Curry
description: Spicy, flavorful, easy Thai curry. Make sure curry paste is vegetarian. Serve with rice.
recipeIngredient: 1 carrot, thinly sliced on the diagonal
½ green bell pepper, cut into thin strips
1 (2 inch) piece galangal, peeled and sliced

recipeInstructions.text: Dab tofu with a clean dish towel to remove excess moisture.
Heat 2 tablespoons peanut oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Fry tofu, turning occasionally, until golden brown, 5 to 8 minutes.
Trim ends of lemongrass stalks and peel off tough outer layers. Pound inner stalks gently with a heavy object to bruise and flatten out.

Heat remaining 1 tablespoon peanut oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir curry paste until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in lemongrass, 1/4 cup coconut milk, eggplants, zucchini, carrot, green bell pepper, galangal, and lime leaves. Simmer until flavors combine, about 5 minutes.

Pour remaining coconut milk into the saucepan. Add soy sauce. Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer until carrot and green bell pepper are nearly tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Stir in fried tofu, bamboo shoots, and green peas. Simmer until bamboo shoots and green peas are heated through, about 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I eat a lot of green curry in Thai restaurants in town and they all vary a bit, so I was keen to try this but not sure of the outcome as it called for galangal with which I am not familiar. I liked the overall flavor and the tofu came out really good, but I did alter the recipe and would alter again if  I give this another try. First of all I omitted ingredients I did not want: carrots, peas, bamboo shoots and  bell peppers. If I make it again I will add more coconut milk because this recipe came out too dry. I'd also peel the eggplants and leave the kefir leaves whole. I ended up picking eggplant skins, lemon grass, kefir leaves and galangal out as I ate as they were tough/inedible. Overall, the flavor was good, but not at all spicy, so I might be tempted to add Thai chili pepper, fish sauce in stead of soy sauce and some Thai basil.
